fields.headline: Award for Ferguson
fields.bodyText: The Rangers captain Barry Ferguson has been named Scotland's footballer of the year, adding the award to the players' player of the year award he collected last month. The Scotland international is only the fifth player to win the award twice, having achieved the accolade three years ago. He joins illustrious company: the Rangers trio John Greig, Sandy Jardine and Brian Laudrup and Celtic striker Henrik Larsson all won the award twice, with Larsson runner-up behind Ferguson this year. Ferguson has scored 18 goals from midfield for Rangers this season, though he did miss two penalties in one game last week as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Dundee.
